CVE-2024-37985
(5.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-29T00:26:19.423000

1 posts

Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T22:58:57.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38183 (8.8 high) GroupMe Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43460 (8.1 high) Dynamics 365 Business Central Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

These two are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, and exploitation less likely. "This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency."

In other news, MSRC updated CVE-2024-37985 (5.9 medium, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft as a EDIT: publicly-disclosed* vulnerability) Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability. "Updated CNA for this CVE to Microsoft and updated the FAQ. This is an informational update only."

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_38183 #CVE_2024_43460 #CVE_2024_37985

CVE-2024-40703
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-27T16:49:46.177000

4 posts

IBM Cognos Analytics 11.2.0, 11.2.1, 11.2.2, 11.2.3, 11.2.4, 12.0.0, 12.0.1, 12.0.2, 12.0.3, and IBM Cognos Analytics Reports for iOS 11.0.0.7 could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information in the form of an API key. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against affected applications.

CVE-2024-46985
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-09-27T16:35:25.473000

4 posts

DataEase is an open source data visualization analysis tool. Prior to version 2.10.1, there is an XML external entity injection vulnerability in the static resource upload interface of DataEase. An attacker can construct a payload to implement intranet detection and file reading. The vulnerability has been fixed in v2.10.1.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-24T09:49:31.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-46985 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-46985/

CVE-2024-9091
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-27T16:22:48.877000

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in code-projects Student Record System 1.0. It has been declared as critical. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /index.php. The manipulation of the argument regno leads to sql injection. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

(9.8 CRITICAL)

2 posts

Information disclosure in Gitlab EE/CE affecting all versions from 15.6 prior to 17.2.8, 17.3 prior to 17.3.4, and 17.4 prior to 17.4.1 in specific conditions it was possible to disclose to an unauthorised user the path of a private project."

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T20:36:04.213Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.4.1, 17.3.4, 17.2.8

  • CVE-2024-4278 (5.5 medium) Maintainer can leak Dependency Proxy password by changing Dependency Proxy URL via crafted POST request
  • CVE-2024-4099 (3.1 low) AI feature reads unsanitized content, allowing for attacker to hide prompt injection
  • CVE-2024-8974 (2.6 low) Project reference can be exposed in system notes

No mention of exploitation

#GitLab #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-47177
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T22:15:04.740000

43 posts

CUPS is a standards-based, open-source printing system, and cups-filters provides backends, filters, and other software for CUPS 2.x to use on non-Mac OS systems. Any value passed to `FoomaticRIPCommandLine` via a PPD file will be executed as a user controlled command. When combined with other logic bugs as described in CVE_2024-47176, this can lead to remote command execution.

1 repos

https://github.com/referefref/cupspot-2024-47177

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
circuit_cat at 2024-09-27T14:13:37.089Z ##

A few days early maybe but it's time for the October Surprise! No it's not a candidate's secret love child or yet another attempt at subverting democracy, IT'S:

Print Spoolers committing RCEs

https://securityintelligence.com/news/fysa-critical-rce-flaw-in-gnu-linux-systems/

##
threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.000Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.000Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.000Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

anthonyfloyd@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T15:58:07.000Z ##

Holy crap. Linux admins, disable your cupsd print services and/or block udp/631 ASAP , re: CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177.

Here's the background (an interesting and somewhat terrifying read):

https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/index.html

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
adulau at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.792Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

##
ache@mastodon.xyz at 2024-09-27T02:06:32.000Z ##

@bohwaz Je vois rien en dessous de 8,4 perso ...

Ok, c'est pas un 9,9, mais 4 > 8.

https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2024-47076-cve-2024-47175-cve-2024-47176-cve-2024-47177-faq-cups-vulnerabilities

##
ptrc@treehouse.systems at 2024-09-26T22:54:10.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog @tony @wdormann yeah, the final command execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-47177) was rated by an unnamed Red Hat employee as 9.9, but they picked "UI:N" ( user interaction: not required ), whereas "sending a print job" usually involves some kind of user interaction; they also chose "AV:N" ( attack vector: network ), but that specific vulnerability is very much local
correcting just those two yields a score of 8.5. one could also argue you'd need low level of privileges ( writing the ppd file ), which lowers it even further to 7.9

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:40:16.000Z ##

@jschauma We set UI:N as once the malicious printer shows up, it could also be fed a print job by an automated queue, AFAICS. But I will ask internally about that. UPDATE for CVE-2024-47177 we did set UI:R but that one got a total of 6.2 Full string is CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:H/A:L see https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog @dangoodin The currently assigned CVE's have these CVSS scores (which are NOT the 9.9 score claimed by the person who found the vulnerability):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
blogdiva@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T21:51:43.000Z ##

WAIT! so i have to restart cups-browsed every time i need to print something? or y'all expecting me to connect to a printer with a cable like some kind of 20th century egghead?!?

Red Hat’s response to OpenPrinting CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.373Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##

blogdiva@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T21:51:43.000Z ##

WAIT! so i have to restart cups-browsed every time i need to print something? or y'all expecting me to connect to a printer with a cable like some kind of 20th century egghead?!?

Red Hat’s response to OpenPrinting CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

CVE-2024-6769
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T21:15:07.787000

2 posts

A DLL Hijacking caused by drive remapping combined with a poisoning of the activation cache in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated attacker to elevate from a medium integrity process to a high integrity process without the intervention of a UAC prompt.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T16:55:18.377000

2 posts

An information disclosure issue has been discovered in GitLab EE affecting all versions starting from 16.5 prior to 17.2.8, from 17.3 prior to 17.3.4, and from 17.4 prior to 17.4.1. A maintainer could obtain a Dependency Proxy password by editing a certain Dependency Proxy setting.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T20:36:04.213Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.4.1, 17.3.4, 17.2.8

  • CVE-2024-4278 (5.5 medium) Maintainer can leak Dependency Proxy password by changing Dependency Proxy URL via crafted POST request
  • CVE-2024-4099 (3.1 low) AI feature reads unsanitized content, allowing for attacker to hide prompt injection
  • CVE-2024-8974 (2.6 low) Project reference can be exposed in system notes

No mention of exploitation

#GitLab #vulnerability #CVE

This is due to the software allowing users to execute an action that does not properly validate a value before running do_shortcode. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary shortcodes.

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:55.343000

20 posts

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vu

Behind the Scenes: The Technical Details of Arc’s Recent Vulnerability https://thecyberexpress.com/arc-browser-vulnerability/ #vulnerabilityintheArcbrowser #FirebaseAccessControlLists #Arcbrowservulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202445489 #DarkWebNews #ACLs

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-21T23:34:41.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-45489 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-45489/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_45489

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-21T18:16:27.188Z ##

Arc: CVE-2024-45489 Incident Report
The cofounder and CTO of Arc gives a personal blog post/advisory for CVE-2024-45489 (9.8 critical, published 20 September 2024) RCE in Arc. See zxy3va's blog post disclosing CVE-2024-45489 in the parent toot above.

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vulnerability with zero affected users.

This post is a longform version of the mitre description above. I started to summarize it and felt like it wasn't necessary if I just quoted the description in its entirety. Arc is making a number of changes to avoid this moving forward and to improve their communication around security vulnerabilities.

cc: @todb

#CVE_2024_45489 #arc #arcbrowser #cloudvulnerability #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T15:42:00.931Z ##

trending on the Bad Place: xyzeva: gaining access to anyones browser without them even visiting a website
Arc is apparently a freeware browser. The problem: CVE-2024-45489 (unknown, supposedly assigned 06 September 2024) allows malicious users to rewrite content shown to other users when they open a page. The attack chain consists of the following steps:

  • obtain the user id of the victim via user referrals, published boosts, or user easels
  • create a malicious boost with a custom payload on one's own account
  • update the boost creatorID field to the targets
  • whenever the victim visits the targeted website, they will get compromised

This was fixed within 1 day of reporting, and assigned a CVE 11 days later, but the information still isn't public. xyzeva also notes potential remote code execution possibilities, and voices privacy concerns.

#arc #browser #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45489 #cve

##

screaminggoat at 2024-09-23T16:16:59.628Z ##

##
avoidthehack at 2024-09-23T14:40:56.440Z ##

Researcher reveals ‘catastrophic’ #security flaw in the Arc browser

(CVE-2024-45489)

The Arc Browser is a fork of #chromium with a lot of built-in features and integrations... and requires an account to use.

Arc Browser uses Firebase to store user information for features like Arc Boosts. Arc Boosts can contain arbitrary javascript... with knowing the CreatorID, an attacker could inject code into other users' browsing sessions.

Crazy to me because this implementation appeared to rely solely on user-provided identities (the CreatorID) without implementing any checks.

They've fixed the issue and are apparently implementing mitigations + moving off Firebase for "future features."

#browsers #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.theverge.com/2024/9/20/24249919/arc-browser-boost-firebase-vulnerability-patched

##
technotenshi at 2024-09-20T17:16:32.205Z ##

A vulnerability (CVE-2024-45489) in the Arc browser allowed attackers to gain access to users' browsers without visiting a malicious website. The flaw stemmed from insecure Firebase Firestore rules, enabling arbitrary changes to user-generated "boosts" (custom scripts for websites). Attackers could modify boosts to execute on a victim's browser by changing creator IDs. Arc has since patched the issue and plans to move away from Firebase.

https://kibty.town/blog/arc/

#infosec #CVE #cybersecurity #Firebase

##
b30@wandzeitung.xyz at 2024-09-23T17:50:22.000Z ##

@343max Ja!

https://arc.net/blog/CVE-2024-45489-incident-response

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T16:16:59.000Z ##

@avoidthehack direct link to security advisory https://arc.net/blog/CVE-2024-45489-incident-response and reporter's blog post https://kibty.town/blog/arc/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T14:40:56.000Z ##

(CVE-2024-45489)

Arc Browser uses Firebase to store user information for features like Arc Boosts. Arc Boosts can contain arbitrary javascript... with knowing the CreatorID, an attacker could inject code into other users' browsing sessions.

Crazy to me because this implementation appeared to rely solely on user-provided identities (the CreatorID) without implementing any checks.

They've fixed the issue and are apparently implementing mitigations + moving off Firebase for "future features."

#browsers #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.theverge.com/2024/9/20/24249919/arc-browser-boost-firebase-vulnerability-patched

Attackers could modify boosts to execute on a victim's browser by changing creator IDs. Arc has since patched the issue and plans to move away from Firebase.

https://kibty.town/blog/arc/

However, it was discovered that for Directors directly connected to the Internet, one of these APIs can be exploited by injecting invalid arguments into a GET request, potentially exposing the authentication

Critical Vulnerability Discovered in Versa Director: What Organizations Need to Know https://cyble.com/blog/critical-vulnerability-discovered-in-versa-director-what-organizations-need-to-know/ #Vulnerability #VersaDirector #CVE202445229

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-21T23:33:41.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-45229 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-45229/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_45229

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T21:55:27.525Z ##

CISA: Versa Networks Releases Advisory for a Vulnerability in Versa Director, CVE-2024-45229
CVE-2024-45229 (6.6 medium, disclosed today) sensitive information disclosure? in Versa Director, see security advisory

The Versa Director offers REST APIs for orchestration and management. By design, certain APIs, such as the login screen, banner display, and device registration, do not require authentication. However, it was discovered that for Directors directly connected to the Internet, one of these APIs can be exploited by injecting invalid arguments into a GET request, potentially exposing the authentication tokens of other currently logged-in users. These tokens can then be used to invoke additional APIs on port 9183. This exploit does not disclose any username or password information.

Versa Networks is not aware of this exploitation in any production systems. A proof of concept exists in the lab environment.

While this is not as serious as it appears, it's an alert from CISA after business hours on a Friday night. Last time, CISA added a fucking Versa Director vulnerability to the KEV Catalog after business hours on a Friday night. Then we come to find out that the Chinese state-sponsored APT Volt Typhoon was exploiting it as a zero-day.

#CVE_2024_45229 #VersaDirector #vulnerability #CVE

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-21T23:33:41.000Z ##

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_45229

These tokens can then be used to invoke additional APIs on port 9183. This exploit does not disclose any username or password information.

CVE-2022-2439

fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-09-29T05:15:23.000Z ##

"A critical bug in Nvidia's widely used Container Toolkit could allow a rogue user or software to escape their containers and ultimately take complete control of the underlying host.

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-0132, earned a 9.0 out of 10 CVSS severity rating, and affects all versions of Container Toolkit up to and including v1.16.1, and Nvidia GPU Operator up to and including 24.6.1."
https://www.theregister.com/2024/09/26/critical_nvidia_bug_container_escape/#:~:text=A%20critical%20bug,and%20including%2024.6.1.

#security

##

CVE-2024-6592
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

4 posts

Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in the protocol communication between the WatchGuard Authentication Gateway (aka Single Sign-On Agent) on Windows and the WatchGuard Single Sign-On Client on Windows and MacOS allows Authentication Bypass.This issue affects the Authentication Gateway: through 12.10.2; Windows Single Sign-On Client: through 12.7; MacOS Single Sign-On Client: through 12.5.4.

1 repos

https://github.com/RedTeamPentesting/watchguard-sso-client

CVE-2024-6594
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

4 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the WatchGuard Single Sign-On Client on Windows causes the client to crash while handling malformed commands. An attacker with network access to the client could create a denial of service condition for the Single Sign-On service by repeatedly issuing malformed commands. This issue affects Single Sign-On Client: through 12.7.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

CVE-2024-20455
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

7 posts

A vulnerability in the process that classifies traffic that is going to the Unified Threat Defense (UTD) component of Cisco IOS XE Software in controller mode could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because UTD improperly handles certain packets as those packets egress an SD-WAN IPsec tunnel. A

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-27T14:58:38.815Z ##

Multiple Denial-of-Service vulnerabilities in CISCO IOS and IOS XE.

Advisory:

https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-75169

CVE-2024-20455 : Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20436 : Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20467 : Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20455 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sdwan-utd-dos-hDATqxs

CVE-2024-20433 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-rsvp-dos-OypvgVZf

CVE-2024-20436 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-httpsrvr-dos-yOZThut

CVE-2024-20464 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-pim-APbVfySJ

CVE-2024-20480 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ios-xe-sda-edge-dos-MBcbG9k

CVE-2024-20467 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cpp-vfr-dos-nhHKGgO

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-20437
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

6 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack and execute commands on the CLI of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient CSRF protections for the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerabi

CVE-2024-20434
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

6 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on the control plane of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper handling of frames with VLAN tag information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted frames to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the at

CVE-2024-20475
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

6 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager, formerly Cisco SD-WAN vManage, could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vuln

  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-20464
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

7 posts

A vulnerability in the Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) feature of Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of received IPv4 PIMv2 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted PIMv2 packet to a PIM-enabled interfa

  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)

  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)

##

CVE-2024-20467
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

7 posts

A vulnerability in the implementation of the IPv4 fragmentation reassembly code in Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper management of resources during fragment reassembly. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specific sizes of fragmented p

1 repos

https://github.com/saler-cve/PoC-Exploit-CVE-2024-20467

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

Meshtastic is an open source, off-grid, decentralized, mesh network. Meshtastic uses MQTT to communicate over an internet connection to a shared or private MQTT Server. Nodes can communicate directly via an internet connection or proxied through a connected phone (i.e., via bluetooth).   • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)

CVE-2024-20433
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

7 posts

A vulnerability in the Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP) feature of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload unexpectedly, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition. This vulnerability is due to a buffer overflow when processing crafted RSVP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability b

  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

A vulnerability in the web UI feature of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack on an affected system through the web UI.   • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)

  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

CVE-2024-46461
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

4 posts

VLC media player 3.0.20 and earlier is vulnerable to denial of service through an integer overflow which could be triggered with a maliciously crafted mms stream (heap based overflow). If successful, a malicious third party could trigger either a crash of VLC or an arbitrary code execution with the target user's privileges.

CVE-2024-40761
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

4 posts

Inadequate Encryption Strength vulnerability in Apache Answer. This issue affects Apache Answer: through 1.3.5. Using the MD5 value of a user's email to access Gravatar is insecure and can lead to the leakage of user email. The official recommendation is to use SHA256 instead. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.4.0, which fixes the issue.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T23:40:29.000Z ##

CVE-2024-9120
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

4 posts

Use after free in Dawn in Google Chrome on Windows prior to 129.0.6668.70 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.838Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-24T18:16:54.124Z ##

Google security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

No mention of exploitation. Excelsior!

#google #chrome #chromium #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-42506
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

3 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

jbhall56 at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.441Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-25T04:33:25.649Z ##

CRITICAL: CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, CVE-2024-42507 -- Multiple Remote code execution vulnerabilities in HPE Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and AOS.

Advisory:
https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=hpesbnw04712en_us&docLocale=en_US

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-09-26T01:00:01.267000

10 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.330Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.000Z ##

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.000Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.288Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##
cedric@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T06:02:10.000Z ##

@adulau actually it started very low:

$ curl -s 'https://api.first.org/data/v1/epss?cve=cve-2024-43491&scope=time-series' | jq '.data[0]."time-series"[-1]'
{
"epss": "0.00712000",
"percentile": "0.80862000",
"date": "2024-09-11"
}

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.000Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

Under certain conditions, an attacker with the ability to redirect users to a malicious site via an open redirect on a trusted site, may be able to spoof the address bar contents. Other versions of Firefox are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox for Android

CVE-2024-38183
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.13%

updated 2024-09-25T19:59:13.653000

1 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in GroupMe allows an a unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network by convincing a user to click on a malicious link.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T22:58:57.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38183 (8.8 high) GroupMe Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43460 (8.1 high) Dynamics 365 Business Central Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

These two are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, and exploitation less likely. "This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency."

In other news, MSRC updated CVE-2024-37985 (5.9 medium, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft as a EDIT: publicly-disclosed* vulnerability) Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability. "Updated CNA for this CVE to Microsoft and updated the FAQ. This is an informational update only."

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_38183 #CVE_2024_43460 #CVE_2024_37985

CVE-2024-9121
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:32:27

4 posts

Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.70 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.838Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-24T18:16:54.124Z ##

Google security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

No mention of exploitation. Excelsior!

#google #chrome #chromium #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-27T14:58:38.815Z ##

Multiple Denial-of-Service vulnerabilities in CISCO IOS and IOS XE.

Advisory:

https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-75169

CVE-2024-20455 : Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20436 : Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20467 : Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20455 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sdwan-utd-dos-hDATqxs

CVE-2024-20433 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-rsvp-dos-OypvgVZf

CVE-2024-20436 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-httpsrvr-dos-yOZThut

CVE-2024-20464 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-pim-APbVfySJ

CVE-2024-20480 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ios-xe-sda-edge-dos-MBcbG9k

CVE-2024-20467 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cpp-vfr-dos-nhHKGgO

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-45410
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-25T17:39:08.033000

4 posts

Traefik is a golang, Cloud Native Application Proxy. When a HTTP request is processed by Traefik, certain HTTP headers such as X-Forwarded-Host or X-Forwarded-Port are added by Traefik before the request is routed to the application. For a HTTP client, it should not be possible to remove or modify these headers. Since the application trusts the value of these headers, security implications might a

1 repos

https://github.com/jphetphoumy/traefik-CVE-2024-45410-poc

mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-09-24T14:09:52.378Z ##

A gnarly, but perhaps a bit overscored, vuln in Traefik:

Basically the issue is that stripping/replacing headers puts those headers in control of the attacker, but RCE would depend on what the application behind Traefik does with them. Still very bad, but not an insta-win.

#CVE_2024_45410 #ThreatIntel

www.cert.europa.eu/publications/security-advisories/2024-102/

updated 2024-09-25T15:14:05.637000

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle Application Development Framework (ADF) product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: ADF Faces). Supported versions that are affected are 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle Application Development Framework (ADF). Successful attacks of this vulnerability can

2 repos

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T14:09:44.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Five Known Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off the press that CISA's press team hasn't created the page yet. 5 are being added to the KEV:

  • CVE-2020-14644 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2019-1069 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high) Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical) Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability

#Cisa #KEV #vulnerability #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

(8.8 HIGH)

updated 2024-09-25T12:30:46

4 posts

Improper verification of cryptographic signature during installation of a VPN driver via the TeamViewer_service.exe component of TeamViewer Remote Clients prior version 15.58.4 for Windows allows an attacker with local unprivileged access on a Windows system to elevate their privileges and install drivers.

##

CVE-2024-45817(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T12:30:46

2 posts

In x86's APIC (Advanced Programmable Interrupt Controller) architecture, error conditions are reported in a status register. Furthermore, the OS can opt to receive an interrupt when a new error occurs. It is possible to configure the error interrupt with an illegal vector, which generates an error when an error interrupt is raised. This case causes Xen to recurse through vlapic_error(). The re

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.029Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

(9.1 CRITICAL)

updated 2024-09-25T06:30:48

2 posts

The WordPress Simple HTML Sitemap plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'id' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.1 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to append additional SQL querie

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:48

1 posts

The Uncanny Groups for LearnDash plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to user group add due to a missing capability check on the /wp-json/ulgm_management/v1/add_user/ REST API endpoint in all versions up to, and including, 6.1.0.1. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with group leader-level access and above, to add users to their group which ultimately allows them to leverage CVE-202

https://github.com/karlemilnikka/CVE-2024-8349-and-CVE-2024-8350

WordPress site-owners running Uncanny Groups for LearnDash, please make sure you’ve updated to version 6.1.1, released 2024-09-11. With previous versions, group leaders can make themselves admins on your site.

CVE-2024-8349
(7.2 HIGH)

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:48

1 posts

The Uncanny Groups for LearnDash plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation in all versions up to, and including, 6.1.0.1. This is due to the plugin not properly restricting what users a group leader can edit. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with group leader-level access and above, to change admin account email addresses which can subsequently lead to admin acc

##

CVE-2024-42505
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:43

3 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

jbhall56 at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.441Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-25T04:33:25.649Z ##

CVE-2024-20017
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T01:36:50.810000

9 posts

In wlan service, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation Patch ID: WCNCR00350938; Issue ID: MSV-1132.

decio at 2024-09-21T10:00:13.337Z ##

#cve_2024_20017 recap
⬇️
"Affected chipsets: MT6890, MT7915, MT7916, MT7981, MT7986, MT7622
⬇️
Affected software: SDK version 7.4.0.1 and before (for MT7915) / SDK version 7.6.7.0 and before (for MT7916, MT7981 and MT7986)"
⬇️
""4 exploits, 1 bug: exploiting cve-2024-20017 4 different ways"

CVE-2024-42259
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T01:15:42.137000

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: drm/i915/gem: Fix Virtual Memory mapping boundaries calculation Calculating the size of the mapped area as the lesser value between the requested size and the actual size does not consider the partial mapping offset. This can cause page fault access. Fix the calculation of the starting and ending addresses, the total size is no

jann at 2024-09-23T15:01:25.837Z ##

back in 2013, @sima published a i915/GEM Crashcourse explaining the Linux kernel i915 GPU driver; I read that earlier this year, and it was really helpful for understanding what is going on in the i915 code and understanding the context of CVE-2024-42259.

I think without that explainer, it would have taken me a long time to understand what GTT MMIO mappings are. The idea that some physical address region owned by the GPU proxies physical memory accesses based on GPU page tables is pretty mindblowing...

##
jann@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T15:01:25.000Z ##

back in 2013, @sima published a i915/GEM Crashcourse explaining the Linux kernel i915 GPU driver; I read that earlier this year, and it was really helpful for understanding what is going on in the i915 code and understanding the context of CVE-2024-42259.

I think without that explainer, it would have taken me a long time to understand what GTT MMIO mappings are. The idea that some physical address region owned by the GPU proxies physical memory accesses based on GPU page tables is pretty mindblowing...

CVE-2024-7593
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.32%

updated 2024-09-25T01:00:03.110000

21 posts

Incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm in Ivanti vTM other than versions 22.2R1 or 22.7R2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass authentication of the admin panel.

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-25T12:18:48.701Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-7593, this auth bypass flaw is caused by an incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm that lets remote unauthenticated attackers circumvent authentication on Internet-exposed vTM admin panels. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-ivanti-vtm-auth-bypass-bug-now-exploited-in-attacks/

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-25T02:56:24.404Z ##

CISA Known Exploited vulnerabilities catalog link: https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T12:18:48.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-7593, this auth bypass flaw is caused by an incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm that lets remote unauthenticated attackers circumvent authentication on Internet-exposed vTM admin panels. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-ivanti-vtm-auth-bypass-bug-now-exploited-in-attacks/

CVE-2024-8907
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-23T18:31:38

1 posts

Insufficient data validation in Omnibox in Google Chrome on Android prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to inject arbitrary scripts or HTML (XSS) via a crafted set of UI gestures. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T22:02:54.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Chrome 129.0.6668.58 (Linux) and 129.0.6668.58/.59 (Windows and Mac) has 9 security fixes, 6 externally reported.

  1. CVE-2024-8904 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  2. CVE-2024-8905 (medium) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  3. CVE-2024-8906 (medium) Incorrect security UI in Downloads
  4. CVE-2024-8907 (medium) Insufficient data validation in Omnibox
  5. CVE-2024-8908 (low) Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  6. CVE-2024-8909 (low) Inappropriate implementation in UI

No mention of exploitation. A mini #PatchTuesday today after seeing VMware and GitLab.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-8908
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-23T17:59:14.137000

1 posts

Inappropriate implementation in Autofill in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T22:02:54.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Chrome 129.0.6668.58 (Linux) and 129.0.6668.58/.59 (Windows and Mac) has 9 security fixes, 6 externally reported.

  1. CVE-2024-8904 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  2. CVE-2024-8905 (medium) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  3. CVE-2024-8906 (medium) Incorrect security UI in Downloads
  4. CVE-2024-8907 (medium) Insufficient data validation in Omnibox
  5. CVE-2024-8908 (low) Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  6. CVE-2024-8909 (low) Inappropriate implementation in UI

No mention of exploitation. A mini #PatchTuesday today after seeing VMware and GitLab.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

  • CVE-2024-38221 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43489 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43496 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

updated 2024-09-20T16:37:49.803000

1 posts

Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in Apache Seata.  When developers disable authentication on the Seata-Server and do not use the Seata client SDK dependencies, they may construct uncontrolled serialized malicious requests by directly sending bytecode based on the Seata private protocol. This issue affects Apache Seata: 2.0.0, from 1.0.0 through 1.8.0. Users are recommended to upg

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-27T05:17:52.106Z ##

CVE-2024-22399 : CVSS Score 9.8 :: Potential Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Apache Seata.. #PatchNOW

https://lists.apache.org/thread/91nzzlxyj4nmks85gbzwkkjtbmnmlkc4

CVE-2024-8963
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 30.99%

updated 2024-09-20T16:32:02.563000

12 posts

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-20T05:19:34.237Z ##

CVE-2024-8963 :: CVSS Score: 9.4 :: Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) addresses a #ZeroDay Path Transversal vulnerability..#PatchNOW
