##

CVE-2023-36050
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2023-11-14T18:30:36

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.746Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

updated 2023-11-14T18:30:35

2 posts

This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

CVE-2022-20707
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 9.63%

updated 2023-11-07T03:42:41.160000

4 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Small Business RV160, RV260, RV340, and RV345 Series Routers could allow an attacker to do any of the following: Execute arbitrary code Elevate privileges Execute arbitrary commands Bypass authentication and authorization protections Fetch and run unsigned software Cause denial of service (DoS) For more information about these vulnerabilities, see the Details sect

pentesttools at 2024-09-27T12:39:54.320Z ##

🍁 As we’re gearing up for event season, we also carved some time for a handful of updates👇

🔍 Asynchronous report generation
👀 Detectors for CVE-2024-5932 (RCE in GiveWP Donation Plugin) & CVE-2023-43770 (XSS in RoundCube)
🎯 Exploits for CVE-2024-5932 & CVE-2022-20707 (Cisco RV Series RCE & auth bypass), RCE in Zyxel, RCE in Apache OFBiz, and more
🕷️ Detection for insecure deserialization in .Net apps
📄 Bulk clone findings in one click

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.62%

updated 2023-09-05T21:05:19

1 posts

Specially crafted requests can be used to access files that exist on the filesystem that is outside an application's root directory, when the Sprockets server is used in production. All users running an affected release should either upgrade or use one of the work arounds immediately. ### Workaround: In Rails applications, work around this issue, set `config.assets.compile = false` and `c

CVE-2021-22005
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.35%

updated 2023-08-08T14:21:49.707000

2 posts

The vCenter Server contains an arbitrary file upload vulnerability in the Analytics service. A malicious actor with network access to port 443 on vCenter Server may exploit this issue to execute code on vCenter Server by uploading a specially crafted file.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T14:31:31.886Z ##

Kaspersky: -=TWELVE=- is back
Kaspersky reports that Twelve, a hacktivism and espionage-oriented threat group that targets Russian government organizations has been observed in a June 2024 cyber attack. Twelve shares infrastructure and TTPs with the DARKSTAR ransomware group (aka Shadow or Comet), which suggests that the two belong to the same syndicate or activity cluster. Kaspersky describes their attack chain, which includes exploiting VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2021-21972 and CVE-2021-22005 (9.8 critical, remote code execution and arbitrary file upload, respectively) to install the FaceFish backdoor. The Lockbit 3.0 and Chaos ransomware used in the attacks creates a ransom note that lacks any contact methods (indicating that Twelve isn't interested in financial extortion). If that wasn't obvious enough, then the Shamoon wiper executed on infrastructure after the ransomware encryption is a good tell. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #twelve #hactivism #darkstar #infosec #IOC #CVE_2021_21972 #CVE_2021_22005 #vmware #vcenter #facefish #vulnerability #wiper #shamoon #ransomware #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #cyberespionage #lockbit #chaos

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:31:31.000Z ##

Kaspersky: -=TWELVE=- is back
Kaspersky reports that Twelve, a hacktivism and espionage-oriented threat group that targets Russian government organizations has been observed in a June 2024 cyber attack. Twelve shares infrastructure and TTPs with the DARKSTAR ransomware group (aka Shadow or Comet), which suggests that the two belong to the same syndicate or activity cluster. Kaspersky describes their attack chain, which includes exploiting VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2021-21972 and CVE-2021-22005 (9.8 critical, remote code execution and arbitrary file upload, respectively) to install the FaceFish backdoor. The Lockbit 3.0 and Chaos ransomware used in the attacks creates a ransom note that lacks any contact methods (indicating that Twelve isn't interested in financial extortion). If that wasn't obvious enough, then the Shamoon wiper executed on infrastructure after the ransomware encryption is a good tell. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #twelve #hactivism #darkstar #infosec #IOC #CVE_2021_21972 #CVE_2021_22005 #vmware #vcenter #facefish #vulnerability #wiper #shamoon #ransomware #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #cyberespionage #lockbit #chaos

CVE-2023-30799
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2023-07-28T13:47:00.313000

2 posts

MikroTik RouterOS stable before 6.49.7 and long-term through 6.48.6 are vulnerable to a privilege escalation issue. A remote and authenticated attacker can escalate privileges from admin to super-admin on the Winbox or HTTP interface. The attacker can abuse this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.

CVE-2023-37582
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.71%

updated 2023-07-20T02:11:34.330000

2 posts

The RocketMQ NameServer component still has a remote command execution vulnerability as the CVE-2023-33246 issue was not completely fixed in version 5.1.1. When NameServer address are leaked on the extranet and lack permission verification, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability by using the update configuration function on the NameServer component to execute commands as the system users tha

CVE-2023-35843
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 6.57%

updated 2023-06-29T17:21:55.743000

2 posts

NocoDB through 0.106.0 (or 0.109.1) has a path traversal vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated attacker to access arbitrary files on the server by manipulating the path parameter of the /download route. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to access sensitive files and data on the server, including configuration files, source code, and other sensitive information.

Nuclei template

CVE-2023-29383
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-04-24T18:05:30.313000

2 posts

In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make

agresor at 2024-09-24T20:10:50.744Z ##

CVE-2023-29383 – nadużywanie polecenia chfn do fałszowania danych z /etc/passwd ( https://nfsec.pl/security/6510 ) #linux #security #twittermigration

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9YNWvnX5z0Q

##

CVE-2020-6007
(7.9 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2023-03-01T03:00:19.090000

2 posts

Philips Hue Bridge model 2.X prior to and including version 1935144020 contains a Heap-based Buffer Overflow when handling a long ZCL string during the commissioning phase, resulting in a remote code execution.

david_chisnall at 2024-09-20T11:03:19.966Z ##

For those who missed SCI Semiconductor's demo at the Digital Security by Design (DSbD) all hands meeting this week, meet Hugh the Lightbulb! We introduced a memory safety bug in the TCP/IP stack similar to CVE-2023-48693 from Azure RTOS in December or the CVE-2020-6007 in Philips Hue lightbulbs. In other systems, these allowed remote arbitrary-code execution. We showed that, in a #CHERIoT system such as SCI's upcoming ICENI line, this becomes a couple of seconds of network disconnection with no impact on the rest of the system.

All of the code for Hugh is available for people to play with.

##
david_chisnall@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T11:03:19.000Z ##

For those who missed SCI Semiconductor's demo at the Digital Security by Design (DSbD) all hands meeting this week, meet Hugh the Lightbulb! We introduced a memory safety bug in the TCP/IP stack similar to CVE-2023-48693 from Azure RTOS in December or the CVE-2020-6007 in Philips Hue lightbulbs. In other systems, these allowed remote arbitrary-code execution. We showed that, in a #CHERIoT system such as SCI's upcoming ICENI line, this becomes a couple of seconds of network disconnection with no impact on the rest of the system.

All of the code for Hugh is available for people to play with.

##

2 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV340 Series Routers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with administrative credentials to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system (OS) as a restricted user. CVE-2022-3590
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2023-01-29T05:01:12

2 posts

WordPress is affected by an unauthenticated blind SSRF in the pingback feature. Because of a TOCTOU race condition between the validation checks and the HTTP request, attackers can reach internal hosts that are explicitly forbidden.

updated 2023-01-27T05:03:54

2 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities exist in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers. A remote attacker could execute arbitrary commands or bypass authentication and upload files on an affected device. For more information about these vulnerabilities, see the Details section of this advisory.

##

CVE-2020-0601
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.96%

updated 2022-08-12T18:40:31.113000

2 posts

A spoofing vulnerability exists in the way Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source, aka 'Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability'.

CVE-2020-11896
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 5.39%

updated 2021-07-21T11:39:23.747000

2 posts

The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 allows Remote Code Execution, related to IPv4 tunneling.

3 repos

https://github.com/advanced-threat-research/Ripple-20-Detection-Logic

https://github.com/0xkol/ripple20-digi-connect-exploit

https://github.com/Fans0n-Fan/Treck20-Related

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T14:55:41.323Z ##

CISA: CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories
Worth noting that Treck TCP/IP Stack (Update I) is on it's NINTH (9th) update, that IDEC Corporation is also vulnerable to a publicly disclosed set of Treck TCP/IP stack vulnerabilities known as Ripple20 (cc: @shellsharks), two of which CVE-2020-11896 and CVE-2020-11897 have perfect CVSSv3 10.0 critical scores 🥳 (cc: @cR0w)

#cisa #ics #vulnerability #CVE

On DrayTek Vigor3900, Vigor2960, and Vigor300B devices before 1.5.1, cgi-bin/mainfunction.cgi/cvmcfgupload allows remote command execution via shell metacharacters in a filename when the text/x-python-script content type is used, a different issue than CVE-2020-14472.

##

CVE-2015-7036
(0 None)

EPSS: 5.45%

updated 2017-07-01T01:29:20.263000

1 posts

The fts3_tokenizer function in SQLite, as used in Apple iOS before 8.4 and OS X before 10.10.4, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a SQL command that triggers an API call with a crafted pointer value in the second argument.

HeadlessZeke@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T13:48:38.000Z ##

Oh hey, my Mazda vuln got publicly disclosed as 0-day: https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-1208/

I will probably write up a blog post about it, but the elevator pitch is that there’s an SQL injection bug in the way Visteon infotainment systems handle iPods that get connected to the car. And because it uses SQLite, you could potentially combine it with the ever-awesome CVE-2015-7036 or something similar to get root code execution.

##

CVE-2024-47076
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

39 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

Print Spoolers committing RCEs

##
threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.000Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.000Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.000Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.373Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##

CVE-2024-47175
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

39 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

Print Spoolers committing RCEs

https://securityintelligence.com/news/fysa-critical-rce-flaw-in-gnu-linux-systems/

##
threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.000Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.000Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.000Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.000Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

#PatchNOW
#Vulnerability
#ComputerSecurity
#hacked
#Cyberattack
#infosec
#informationsecurity
#DataBreach
#cybersecurity

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
adulau at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.792Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.373Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
adulau@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.000Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

ache@mastodon.xyz at 2024-09-27T02:06:32.000Z ##

jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##

CVE-2024-47176
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.06%

51 posts

N/A

Nuclei template

5 repos

https://github.com/workabhiwin09/CVE-2024-47176

https://github.com/tonyarris/CVE-2024-47176-Scanner

https://github.com/mr-r3b00t/CVE-2024-47176

https://github.com/aytackalinci/CVE-2024-47176

https://github.com/GO0dspeed/spill

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

##
TomSellers at 2024-09-27T13:18:52.066Z ##

FYI for Ubuntu users concerned about the CUPS vulnerability:

Ubuntu released a patch for cups-browsed roughly 16 hours ago. If your system is configured with unattended-upgrades the patch may already be applied. I've seen it automatically applied on two of my lab systems.

As a note, Desktop installations of Ubuntu and Kubuntu appear to be vulnerable in their default state until the patch is applied. Pop!_OS and KDE Neon, both Ubuntu based, are similarly impacted in their default configurations.

Just update your packages and you should be fine.

Reference:
https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7042-1

#security #cups #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.000Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

#cybersecurity

##
anthonyfloyd@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T15:58:07.000Z ##

Holy crap. Linux admins, disable your cupsd print services and/or block udp/631 ASAP , re: CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177.

Here's the background (an interesting and somewhat terrifying read):

https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/index.html

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T12:39:22.000Z ##

New CUPS vulnerabilities in #Linux can lead to remote command execution via print jobs. Debian, Fedora, and RHEL are affected. CVE-2024-47176 details: https://t.co/lBdN5A4tZr. To mitigate, disable cups-browsed & block UDP port 631 until patch. #CyberSecurity #LinuxSecurity

##
adulau at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.792Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

##
ache@mastodon.xyz at 2024-09-27T02:06:32.000Z ##

@bohwaz Je vois rien en dessous de 8,4 perso ...

Ok, c'est pas un 9,9, mais 4 > 8.

https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2024-47076-cve-2024-47175-cve-2024-47176-cve-2024-47177-faq-cups-vulnerabilities

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog @dangoodin The currently assigned CVE's have these CVSS scores (which are NOT the 9.9 score claimed by the person who found the vulnerability):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
blogdiva@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T21:51:43.000Z ##

WAIT! so i have to restart cups-browsed every time i need to print something? or y'all expecting me to connect to a printer with a cable like some kind of 20th century egghead?!?

Red Hat’s response to OpenPrinting CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T21:35:18.000Z ##

some are saying that the CVSS is 9.9 -

CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed bugs and other bugs can combine, leading to info leak and remote code execution CUPS.

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
secfurry@meow.social at 2024-09-26T20:51:44.000Z ##

So I just read the report on CVE-2024-47176. It should not be a 9.9.
It's literally an exploit on "cups-browsed" over 631/udp, which should not be open to the *net anyway. Like it's a nice overflow exploit, but the barrier to exploit is waaay to high. 🤦‍♀️

#infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.373Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##
anthonyfloyd@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T15:58:07.000Z ##

Holy crap. Linux admins, disable your cupsd print services and/or block udp/631 ASAP , re: CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177.

https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/index.html

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

CVE-2024-44193
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

aapl@mastodon.ml at 2024-09-27T05:01:15.000Z ##

📄 Apple обновила iTunes для Windows (https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/9pb2mz1zmb1s?rtc=1&amp;hl=ru-ru&amp;gl=BR) до версии 12.13.3

Внутри, помимо поддержки новых систем и устройств, также закрыта критическая уязвимость под кодом CVE-2024-44193, позволявшая злоумышленнику иметь приоритет над параметрами программы.

iTunes на Windows до сих пор работает и обновляется, при том, что у компании для этой системы также есть параллельно три отдельных приложения: 🔄 Apple Devices, 🎵 Apple Music и 📺 Apple TV.
